isis.stitle: STARTING MOTORS - SOLENOID CHECKS - PULL-OUT WINDING TEST

svcproc.title: PULL-OUT WINDING TEST
svcproc.para: To check the pull-in winding connect the solenoid switch terminal to the solenoid motor terminal ( Figure 19). Compare the ammeter readings with the pull-in winding specification. A high amp reading indicates a shorted pull-in winding, and a low reading indicates excessive resistance.

figure.caption: Testing Pull-In Windings on Three-Terminal and Four- Terminal Solenoids

caution.para: To avoid excessive heating, do not leave the pull-in winding connected for more than 10 seconds at a time. The current will normally decrease as the heating increases.

svcproc.para: To check for grounds, move battery lead from "M" terminal ( Figure 18) to a clean ground on the solenoid case (not shown). Ammeter should read zero. If not, hold-in or pull-in winding is grounded.

note.para: To reduce the voltage to the specified value, connect the carbon pile between the battery and the "M" terminal as shown. If the carbon pile is not needed, connect a jumper directly from the battery to the "M" terminal.
